metadata.title: Convert Megajoules to Joules – Energy Converter
metadata.description: Convert energy from Megajoules (MJ) to Joules (J), useful for detailed energy calculations.

introduction: This converter transforms megajoules to joules for detailed energy analysis.
Engineering calculations require base joule unit while industrial specs use megajoules.
This converter uses the relationship where 1 megajoule equals 1 million joules.
methodology: 1 MJ = 1,000,000 J. To convert megajoules to joules, multiply by 1,000,000.
Expressing energy in joules enables precise calculations.
Understanding megajoule to joule conversion is essential for energy engineering.
This converter provides accurate energy conversion.

faqs.question: Why use megajoules instead of joules?
faqs.answer: Large numbers. 1,000,000 joules harder to grasp than 1 megajoule.

faqs.question: How do I calculate energy from power?
faqs.answer: Energy (J) = Power (W) × Time (s). 1 kW × 1 hour = 3.6 million joules.

faqs.question: What's the most energetic event?
faqs.answer: Earthquake: billions of megajoules. Explosion: millions of megajoules.

faqs.question: How efficient is energy conversion?
faqs.answer: Solar panels: ~15-20%. Gas engines: ~25-40%. Always have losses.

faqs.question: What's potential vs kinetic energy?
faqs.answer: Potential: stored (at height). Kinetic: motion energy. Sum = total mechanical energy.

faqs.question: Why does food use calories not joules?
How do I minimize energy use?
faqs.answer: Efficiency improvements, conservation, renewable energy, smart scheduling.

glossary.definition: Useful output divided by total input.
